intro: Draba nemorosa, commonly known as the wood mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It typically reaches heights of 5–20 cm and features basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters during the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Draba nemorosa is characterized by its delicate appearance and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
